sentence.Network_en: By now the government was well aware of the steadfastness and strength of his resistance.
sentence.Network_cn: 此刻政府已经清楚地意识到他的反抗是何等的坚定有力。

sentence.Network_en: But he was attacked with increasing boldness and steadfastness.
sentence.Network_cn: 但他却受到日益大胆和坚决的攻击.

sentence.Network_en: There was an unceremonious directness, a searching, decided steadfastness in his gaze now.
sentence.Network_cn: 现在他的凝视中有一种不礼貌的直率, 一种锐利 、 断然的坚定.

entry.tran: 坚定的;坚信的;坚贞不渝的
entry.def: If someone is steadfast in something that they are doing, they are convinced that what they are doing is right and they refuse to change it or to give up.

example.ex: He remained steadfast in his belief that he had done the right thing.
example.tran: 他一直坚信自己做得对。

means.word_mean: 1. loyalty in the face of trouble and difficulty
